content:
Web-public stream created by Morgan Rogers (he/him). Description:

sign up here! https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10tCx3l1wqH9pf-q1EQys9oT5QOxozmBdklVf0uY57A8/edit
This is a stream for the online seminar initiated by @Jean-Baptiste Vienney here. I subscribed all users for maximum visibility. As usual, please mute this stream if you are not interested.
Would it be possible to add this seminar to https://researchseminars.org/ so that there's a convenient calendar link?

Okay! Here is a link.
https://researchseminars.org/seminar/CaTheoryZulip

Its not publicly viewable yet as neither JBV nor I are Endorsed, but the zoom info etc. was filled out and at the bottom you should be able to export to gcal etc.

Only issue is that some weeks we need to hold the seminar at a different time (Urs Schreiber's talk comes to mind) but researchseminars.org does not (appear to) allow me the granularity to adjust such things.

If you want to have a link that will always be correct @Nathanael Arkor I can add you directly to the gcal event I created; DM me your email. Eventually we'll have a better setup, but for now your patience and forebearance is appreciated.
Ah! Ok I think I found the place to add in weekly adjustments. OK nvm.

@Nathanael Arkor @Valeria de Paiva do either of you know any of the people on this list?
https://researchseminars.org/user/public/

Until JBV or I get an endorsement from one of them, it doesn't look like others can even view our seminar page. :/

Hi, @Eric M Downes I do know several people on that list. We can send email to Emily Riehl. Naturally I'd contact Brendan Fong, but I know he's very busy tomorrow, so Emily or Sam Schiavone would be my suggestion. I just noticed that I am in the list at the end, so I can endorse you guys. just sent them email, saying so!

Hi,

The seminar worked pretty well this summer. Concerning the future:

  • I prefer not spending too much energy on this during the academic year.
  • I'd like to run again this seminar each summer (from May to August).
  • Alternatively, if someone (or several people) wants to help making the seminar year round, he can DM @Eric M Downes or me.
